Real work experience counts for alot, and a glowing review by your manager would definitely add to your resume.0 comments1

Joyce Chan, Senior Financial Consultant at Prudential Assurance Company SingaporeLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 31 Jul 2019The seedly community would definitely need more information about you, your preferences, your background etc. before we can provide good suggestions.
Nonetheless, if you are looking for interim jobs as you are figuring out what to do next, you might want to look for jobs that give you better exposure / enable you to talk to more people. Such jobs could be doing sales and exposing yourself to people from all walks of life, interning at an industry of your choice, doing admin stints in multiple companies etc.
